section.name: Welcome to Wicket Stuff
section.p: The Wicket Stuff project provides additional Java web components to the core components supplied by the Wicket framework. Wicket is a Java web application framework that takes simplicity, separation of concerns and ease of development to a whole new level.

The Wicket Stuff project provides non-core components to the Wicket project. By non-core we mean that the Wicket project should focus on being a very focused framework, not distracted by development of other frameworks, such as Hibernate, Velocity, FreeMarker, Google Maps, DOJO Toolkit, fValidate, Groovy, JasperReports... This enables the core developers to focus on creating a first class framework, and the other developers to create many components, that the core couldn't foresee to maintain.

The components, libaries and examples found here are all in a different stage of development and maturity. For a full list of available projects, check the root directory of our subversion repository.
Projects that have released a package can be found on the Wicket Stuff SourceForge download page. Components offered by this project include:

section.name: Spring integration
section.p: If you are looking for Spring integration, then we are pleased to announce that the Spring integration project has been promoted to a core project, and can be downloaded from the Wicket downloads section.

section.name: Kickstart project
section.p: The kickstart project has been renamed, and also promoted to a core project found at Wicket Quickstart.

section.name: Special Thanks
section.p: The Wicket Stuff development team would like to thank the following partners for supporting Open Source in general and Wicket in particular.
